### Read A Paper

```{r echo=FALSE}
unchecked <- as.character(fontawesome::fa("square", fill = "#63d6c6"))

checked <- as.character(fontawesome::fa("check-square", fill = "#63d6c6"))

pdf_link1 <- function() {
 paste0("<a href='/handouts/Iloh%20(2021).pdf' target='_blank'>", "<img src='/logos/pdf-ico.png' alt='Slack icon' width='40'>", "</a>")
}

readings <- tibble(
  
  paper <- c("Iloh (2021). Do It for the Culture: The Case for Memes in Qualitative Research. <i>International Journal of Qualitative Methods</i> (20). 1-10. <a href='https://doi.org/10.1177/16094069211025896' target='_blank'>https://doi.org/10.1177/16094069211025896</a>"
  ),
  
  download <- c(
    pdf_link1()
  ),
  
  .name_repair = "minimal"
  
)

```

<center>
```{r, echo=FALSE}
readings %>%
  kbl(col.names = c("Source", "Link"), 
      "html", 
      escape = FALSE,
      align = 'lc') %>%
  kable_paper(full_width = F) %>%
  column_spec(1, width = "30em", color = "#ffffff", extra_css = 'vertical-align: middle !important;') %>%
  column_spec(2, width = "10em", color = "#ffffff", extra_css = 'vertical-align: middle !important;') %>% 
  row_spec(0:1, extra_css = 'vertical-align: middle !important;', color = "#ffffff", background = "transparent") 

```
</center>
